title: High Net Investment in Nonfinancial Assets
description: In 2016, Timor-Leste recorded a net investment in nonfinancial assets at 40.29% of its GDP, indicating a strong focus on infrastructure and capital development.

title: Significant Other Expenses
description: In 2022, 42.80% of Timor-Leste's expenses were categorized as 'other expenses,' suggesting potential inefficiencies or unclassified spending in the national budget.

title: High Energy Depletion Rate
description: Timor-Leste experienced a 57.20% depletion of energy resources relative to its GNI in 2021, highlighting a significant reliance on energy resources for economic activities.

title: Natural Resources Depletion Concerns
description: In 2021, the depletion of natural resources in Timor-Leste accounted for 57.30% of its GNI, raising concerns about sustainability and resource management.

title: Dependence on Natural Gas Rents
description: Natural gas rents constituted 29.38% of Timor-Leste's GDP in 2021, indicating a heavy reliance on this sector for economic stability.

title: High Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2016, 62.8% of women in Timor-Leste believed that a husband is justified in beating his wife if she neglects the children, reflecting deep-rooted cultural issues regarding gender equality.

title: Low Quality of Public Services for Business
description: In 2024, Timor-Leste scored 3.2 in the Quality of Public Services and Transparency of Information for Business Location, indicating challenges in providing efficient public services for businesses.

title: Challenges in Dispute Resolution Services
description: Timor-Leste's Dispute Resolution Public Services scored 7.8 in 2024, reflecting difficulties in resolving business disputes efficiently.

title: Limited Financial Services Accessibility
description: In 2024, the Accessibility of Information in Credit Infrastructure in Timor-Leste was rated at 5.8, highlighting limited access to financial services information.

title: Weak Market Competition Regulations
description: Timor-Leste's regulations promoting market competition scored 22.3 in 2024, indicating a need for stronger regulatory frameworks to enhance competition.

title: Decline in Export Growth
description: In 2023, Timor-Leste experienced a significant decline in exports of goods and services, with an annual growth rate of -59.99%.

title: Negative Industrial Growth
description: The industry sector, including construction, in Timor-Leste saw a -56.97% growth rate in 2023, indicating a contraction in industrial activities.

title: Decreasing National Income
description: Adjusted net national income in Timor-Leste decreased by -65.66% in 2021, reflecting economic challenges.

title: High Inflation Rates
description: In 2023, Timor-Leste faced a high inflation rate with the GDP deflator at -20.83%, affecting the cost of living and economic stability.
